poem:
A Glimmer in Tehran

This morning, a reformist whispers
across the ancient valleys, 
nuclear shadows lifting just slightly,
his pen tracing the thin line
between sanctions and sunlight.
He speaks of America,
like an old lover crooning a song,
and we listen, 
drinking in the warm possibility
that history might pivot at breakfast.
